definitions.body: maid, maid-servant (syn. [[אָמָה]], q. v.; orig.= concubine ? cf. √);—abs. ´[[שׁ]]: Ge 16:1 +; cstr. [[שִׁפְחַת]] v:Ge 16:2 +; sf. [[שִׁפְחָתִי]] v:Ge 16:2 +, etc.; pl. abs. [[שְׁפָחוֹת]] Ge 12:16 +; sf. [[שִׁפְחׂתֶָךָ]] Ru 2:13, etc.;—

lit., maid, maid-servant, as belonging to a mistress Ge 16:1, Ge 16:3, Ge 16:6, Ge 16:8 (PJ) Ge 29:24, Ge 29:29 (P) Ps 123:2, Pr 30:23, Is 24:2; even where concubine of master (cf. [[אָמָה]]) Ge 16:2, Ge 16:5 (PJ) Ge 25:12, Ge 35:25, Ge 35:26 (P) Ge 30:4, Ge 30:7, Ge 30:9, Ge 30:10, Ge 30:12, Ge 30:18 (all JE); less oft. ref. to master Ge 29:24, Ge 29:29 (J), Ru 2:13, of concubine Ge 32:23, cf. Ge 33:1, Ge 33:2, Ge 33:6 (all J) ; marriageable Le 19:20 (H, cf. Ex 11:5; not elsewhere in legisl.); in gen., esp. of menial service (never [[אָמָה]]) Ex 11:5 (J) 1Sa 25:41 (opp. [[אָמָה]]) 2Sa 17:17 (‖[[עֶבֶד ]]) Ge 12:16, Ge 24:35(J) Ge 20:14 (E) Ge 30:43 (P) Ge 32:6 (J; coll.)
